intro: Draba oreodoxa, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small herbaceous species characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia, it thrives in rocky and alpine environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–15 cm and produces numerous tiny seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Due to its hardy nature and ability to survive in harsh conditions, it is often found in high-altitude meadows and scree slopes.
